column2: FLORIDA DMV WRITTEN TEST
Question Text
1. This sign warns drivers that:
column10: they will soon be facing oncoming traffic.

column2: 2. This sign indicates:
3. This driver is using hand signals to show that he is about to:
4. You should signal your intentions to turn at least for the last _____ before turning.
5. Green and white signs:
column4: warn drivers of unexpected road conditions.
column6: are mainly used at intersections and driveways.
column8: give information about directions and distances.

column2: 6. A white light must make the license plate visible from __ feet.
7. In Florida, vehicle registration certificate and license plate must be obtained within __ days after beginning employment.
8. Driving too slowly:
column6: should be avoided when you are impatient.

column2: 9. Pentagonal signs are used to indicate:
10. What does a red arrow signal mean?
column4: Do not make the movement shown by the arrow until the green light appears.
column6: After stopping, you may turn right if there is not a NO TURN ON RED sign and the way is clear.
column8: You may turn left from a one-way street onto a one-way street that has traffic moving to the left.

column2: 11. Bicyclists under the age of __ are required to wear helmets that meet federal safety standards.
12. Which of the following is a serious violation of the License Law:
column6: Allowing an unlicensed person to use your car.
column8: Having more than one U.S. driver license.

column2: 13. Who must wear safety belts in Florida?
column4: Only passengers under the age of 16.
column6: The driver and all passengers, regardless of their age.
column8: The driver and all passengers under the age of 21.
column10: The driver and front seat passengers, and all passengers under 18 years old.

column2: 14. This sign warns that:
column4: the bridge ahead is wide enough for only one vehicle at a time.

column2: 15. This sign means:
16. Which of the following is a way to avoid road rage?
column6: Not getting behind the wheel if you are tired.
column8: Making eye contact with other drivers.

column2: 17. If a law enforcement officer stops a vehicle and finds a front seat passenger 17 years of age or younger not wearing a seat belt, a seat belt violation will be charged to:
column10: both the driver and the passenger.

column2: 18. A three-point turn is used:
column4: to turn your car around in a small space.
column6: on a curve, when a sign indicates that making a U-turn is prohibited.
column8: to indicate your intention to turn.

column2: 19. A traffic sign with a red circle around and a slash over a symbol means:
column4: the maneuver shown on the sign can be executed only after coming to a complete stop.
column6: the maneuver shown on the sign should be executed with extreme caution.
column8: Do not drive faster than the posted speed limit.
column10: the maneuver shown by the symbol is not allowed.

column2: 20. Which of the following is NOT a serious violation of the License Law:
column4: Changing your license in any way.
column6: Making a fraudulent application for a driver license.
column10: None of the other answers are correct.

column2: 21. Low-beam headlights can show objects ___ feet ahead.
22. On an upgrade, passing a truck is often:
23. You must complete a department approved driver improvement course if you were convicted of your ____ traffic offense that caused a crash within __ months.
24. Who must wear safety belts?
column4: The driver and front passengers under the age of 18.
column8: The driver and all passengers under the age of 18.
column10: The driver and front passengers under the age of 16.

column2: 25. When passing a truck, you should:
column6: complete your pass as quickly as possible.
column8: cut in between the commercial vehicle and the curb to the right.
column10: avoid blinking your headlights to let the truck driver know you are passing.

column2: 26. When are lane signals used?
column4: To show that a toll booth is open or closed.
column6: To show which lanes are opened or closed.
column8: When the direction of the flow of traffic changes during the day.

column2: 27. While walking along a highway without a sidewalk, you should:
column4: walk on the side of the road with less traffic.
column8: always walk on the shoulder on the left side, facing traffic.
column10: walk in the same direction as traffic.

column2: 28. If, while driving, you hit a vehicle with no one in it, you must:
29. Road rage can:
column6: be an indirect consequence of aggressive driving.
column8: result in crashes or other incidents.
column10: be avoided by cutting off other drivers.

column2: 30. A driver of a car being passed:
column6: must not increase speed until the pass is complete.
column8: must move to the left side of his/her lane to help the other driver pass safely.
column10: must increase speed before the pass is complete.

column2: 31. When you are driving on a multi-lane road, if another vehicle moves into your lane right in front of you, cutting you off, you should:
column6: stay calm. Slow down if necessary to avoid a crash, and gently drop back to a safe following distance.
column8: overtake and pass the other vehicle immediately.
column10: honk your horn and ask the other driver to pull off.

column2: 32. On a two way street, a stopped school bus is picking up children. Drivers must:
column4: overtake and pass the bus before the bus’ stop arm is withdrawn.
column8: stop and remain stopped until all children are clear of the roadway and the bus’ stop arm is withdrawn.
column10: yield to vehicles coming in the opposite direction.

column2: 33. Crossing guards are the ____ to enter and ____ to exit a crosswalk to indicate to drivers that pedestrians are about to cross.
34. When parking on a public road, drivers should:
column4: always park on the left side of the roadway.
column6: pull as far away from the roadside shoulder as possible.
column8: move as far away from traffic as possible.

column2: 35. You are driving along an expressway with a speed limit of 70 MPH. What is the minimum speed limit, unless otherwise posted?
36. When you are driving on a paved highway that does not have a paved shoulder, if your vehicle breaks down you should:
column4: try to reach the next available paved shoulder.
column8: try to get your vehicle completely out of traffic lanes and off the paved surface of the highway before stopping.
column10: come to a complete stop and use your emergency flashers.

column2: 37. Most signs used in street work areas are:
38. When driving in a roundabout, drivers should:
column4: change lane to indicate their intention to exit.
column8: use the left turn signal to indicate their intention to exit.
column10: use the right turn signal to indicate their intention to exit.

column2: 39. What should you do as you prepare to turn right at an intersection?
column4: Yield to bicyclists coming from the opposite direction.
column6: Signal your turn, check for bicyclists, and do not turn directly in front of a bicyclist.

column2: 40. When infractions occur within a school zone or construction zone, the resulting fines are:
41. Which signs have black letters on a yellow or orange background?
42. Expressways are:
column4: single-lane roads with traffic lights, stop signs and railroad crossings.
column6: single-lane roads with no traffic lights and stop signs.
column10: multiple-lane roads with no traffic lights, stop signs or railroad crossings.

column2: 43. A parent of a child younger than 6 years of age may NOT:
column4: secure the child in the rear seat.
column8: leave the child unattended in a motor vehicle for more than 15 minutes.
column10: drive faster than 25 MPH under any circumstances.

column2: 44. At 50 MPH, the impact and  braking distance are __ times greater than at 25 MPH.
45. At night, glare from oncoming cars can:
46. Pedestrians approaching a railroad-highway grade crossing must stop when:
column4: a human flagger is warning of an approaching train.
column6: an approaching train is clearly visible.

column2: 47. High beam headlights are most effective for speeds faster than:
48. When entering an expressway, never stop in the acceleration lane unless:
column4: you receive a very important text.
column6: there are one or more vehicles behind you.
column8: you need to make a U-turn.
column10: traffic is too heavy for you to merge safely.

column2: 49. If you are in the lane marked with a curved arrow and the word ONLY:
column6: You are the only driver in the lane who can turn left.
column8: You are the only driver in the lane who MUST turn in the direction of the arrow.

column2: 50. What is an ideal situation for overtaking and passing another vehicle on the right?
column4: Passing a vehicle on the right is never allowed.
column6: When it's dark, you had more than a few drinks, you are driving 40 MPH above the speed limit and your radio is playing hard rock music.
column8: When the vehicle you are passing is making a right turn.
column10: When the vehicle you are passing is making or about to make a left turn.
